trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Onit | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Onit | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Onit with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Onit with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Onit.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Onit.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: An Onit single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: An Onit single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Onit will be able to single sign into the application at your Onit company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Onit will be able to single sign into the application at your Onit company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Onit
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Onit

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Onit.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Onit.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Onit.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Onit.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Onit, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Onit, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Onit</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Onit</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Onit with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Onit with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Onit requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Onit requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Your Onit application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.
trans-unit.target: Your Onit application expects the SAML assertions in a specific format, which requires you to add custom attribute mappings to your saml token attributes configuration.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows an example for this.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows an example for this.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Onit application integration page, in the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Onit application integration page, in the menu on the top, click Attributes to open the SAML Token Attributes dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Attributes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To add the required attribute mappings, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: |Attribute Name|Attribute Value| |---|---| |name|User.userprincipalname| |email|User.mail|
trans-unit.target: |Attribute Name|Attribute Value| |---|---| |name|User.userprincipalname| |email|User.mail|

trans-unit.source: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.
trans-unit.target: For each data row in the table above, click add user attribute.

trans-unit.source: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: In the Attribute Name textbox, type the attribute name shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: From the Attribute Value list, select the attribute value shown for that row.
trans-unit.target: From the Attribute Value list, select the attribute value shown for that row.

trans-unit.source: Click Complete.
trans-unit.target: Click Complete.

trans-unit.source: Click Apply Changes.
trans-unit.target: Click Apply Changes.

trans-unit.source: In your browser, click Back to open the Quick Start dialog again.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, click Back to open the Quick Start dialog again.

trans-unit.source: Click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: Click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Onit page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Onit page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Onit Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Onit application (e.g.: "https://ms-sso-test.onit.com”), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Onit Sign On URL textbox, type the URL used by your users to sign on to your Onit application (e.g.: "https://ms-sso-test.onit.com”), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Onit page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Onit page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Onit company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Onit company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the menu on the top, click Administration.
trans-unit.target: In the menu on the top, click Administration.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Edit Corporation.
trans-unit.target: Click Edit Corporation.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit Corporation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit Corporation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the Security tab.
trans-unit.target: Click the Security tab.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit Company Information</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit Company Information</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Security tab, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Security tab, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: As Authentication Strategy, select Single Sign On and Password.
trans-unit.target: As Authentication Strategy, select Single Sign On and Password.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Onit dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Idp Target URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Onit dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Idp Target URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Onit dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Idp logout URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Onit dialog page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Idp logout URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Idp Cert Fingerprint (SHA1) textbox.
trans-unit.target: Copy the Thumbprint value from the exported certificate, and then paste it into the Idp Cert Fingerprint (SHA1) textbox.

trans-unit.source: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more details, see <linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: As SSO Type, select SAML.
trans-unit.target: As SSO Type, select SAML.

trans-unit.source: In the SSO login button text textbox, type a button text you like.
trans-unit.target: In the SSO login button text textbox, type a button text you like.

trans-unit.source: Select Login with SSO: Required for the following domains/users, type the email address of a test user into the related textbox, and then click Update.
trans-unit.target: Select Login with SSO: Required for the following domains/users, type the email address of a test user into the related textbox, and then click Update.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Edit Corporation</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Edit Corporation</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Onit, they must be provisioned into Onit.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Onit, they must be provisioned into Onit.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Onit, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Onit, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Sign on to your Onit company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Sign on to your Onit company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Administration</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Administration</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Add User dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add User dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the Name and the Email Address of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the Name and the Email Address of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Create.
trans-unit.target: Click Create.

trans-unit.source: The account owner will get an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.
trans-unit.target: The account owner will get an email including a link to confirm the account before it becomes active.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Onit user account creation tools or APIs provided by Onit to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Onit user account creation tools or APIs provided by Onit to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Onit **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Onit **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
